alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clay; Marshall; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Riley; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 9:12PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Riley, northern Pottawatomie, Nemaha, western Brown, Clay, Washington and Marshall Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 912 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Verdon to 3 miles south of Beattie to Clifton. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clay Center, Marysville, Hiawatha, Sabetha, Seneca, Washington, Blue Rapids, Blaine, Frankfort, Onaga, Hanover, Waterville, Clifton, Centralia, Leonardville, Linn, Axtell, Greenleaf, Fairview and Morrill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central and northeastern Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Clay; Marshall; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Riley; Washington
